module.title: toponymic name-descriptions
module.p: Toponymic namifications are name-descriptions which are also toponyms, i.e. they are (usually definite) common noun phrases used to name places (geographical entities).
Pre-specified toponymic name-descriptions – An t-Àth Leathann Broadford, A’ Chomraich Applecross, An Agaidh Mhòr Aviemore
Post-specified toponymic name-descriptions – Baile Bhòid Rothesay, Baile nan Granndach Grantown-on-Spey, Baile Ailein Balallan, Baile an t-Sealgair Hunterston, Baile Ùr an t-Slèibhe Newtonmore
Toponymic improper/uncommon nouns – An Fhraing France, A’ Ghearmailt Germany, i.e. pre-specified toponymic name-descriptions where the noun does not appear to be a common noun. (cf. am Bìoball ???)

ul.li: [p. 104] gu ceann Leitir Blàr a’ Chaorthainn to the head of the Slope of the Field of the Rowan [Why not Bhlàr?]
